responsePreview: Found 10 dishes: Ceviche, Lomo Saltado, Pachamanca...

meals.name: Ceviche
meals.description: A traditional Peruvian dish of raw fish marinated in lime juice, mixed with chili, onion, and coriander. It is culturally significant as a national symbol and is recognized by UNESCO as Intangible Cultural Heritage, widely consumed daily and at celebrations.
healthy_modifications: serve with sweet potato and cancha corn for fiber

meals.name: Lomo Saltado
meals.description: A popular stir-fry dish combining beef, tomatoes, onions, and Peruvian yellow chili, reflecting the fusion of indigenous and Chinese influences in Peru.
healthy_modifications: serve with quinoa instead of white rice

meals.name: Pachamanca
meals.description: An ancestral Andean dish where meats, potatoes, corn, and herbs are slow-cooked underground on hot stones, symbolizing community and connection to the earth.

meals.name: Anticuchos
meals.description: Grilled skewers traditionally made from beef heart, seasoned and cooked over open flames, a beloved street food with deep cultural roots.
healthy_modifications: use leaner cuts or chicken breast

meals.name: Aji de Gallina
meals.description: A creamy chicken stew with a spicy yellow chili sauce, potatoes, and cheese, widely enjoyed across Peru as comfort food.
healthy_modifications: use low-fat milk or broth instead of cream
use whole grain bread for thickening

meals.name: Causa Limeña
meals.description: A layered cold dish made from mashed yellow potatoes seasoned with lime and chili, filled with tuna, chicken, or avocado, popular as an appetizer.
healthy_modifications: use olive oil instead of mayonnaise
use fresh tuna or chicken breast

meals.name: Tacu Tacu
meals.description: A traditional dish of rice and beans fried together, originally a way to use leftovers, now a staple with variations including seafood or meat.
healthy_modifications: add vegetables like spinach or peppers

meals.name: Papa a la Huancaína
meals.description: Boiled potatoes served with a spicy, creamy cheese sauce made from yellow chili and queso fresco, a classic starter from the Huancayo region.
healthy_modifications: add lettuce or other greens as base

meals.name: Pollo a la Brasa
meals.description: Peruvian rotisserie chicken marinated with spices and cooked over charcoal, a national favorite for its smoky flavor and crispy skin.
healthy_modifications: serve with salad instead of fries

meals.name: Ocopa
meals.description: Boiled potatoes topped with a spicy sauce made from huacatay herb, peanuts, and yellow chili, similar to Papa a la Huancaína but with distinct flavors.
healthy_modifications: substitute peanuts with walnuts for omega-3

responsePreview: Found 10 dishes: Ceviche, Pachamanca, Lomo Saltado...

meals.name: Ceviche
meals.description: A quintessential Peruvian dish of raw fish marinated in lime juice, mixed with onions, chili, and cilantro. It is a cultural symbol of coastal Peru and widely consumed daily and at celebrations, representing social cohesion and artisanal fishing traditions.
healthy_modifications: add more fresh vegetables like sweet potato or corn on the side

meals.name: Pachamanca
meals.description: An ancient Andean ritual dish cooked underground with volcanic stones, combining lamb, pork, chicken, native potatoes, corn, fava beans, and Andean herbs. It honors Pachamama (Mother Earth) and is a communal feast celebrating tradition and gratitude.
healthy_modifications: increase proportion of tubers and legumes
limit added salt or fatty marinades

meals.name: Lomo Saltado
meals.description: A popular stir-fry dish blending indigenous and Chinese influences, featuring beef strips, tomatoes, onions, and yellow chili, served with rice and potatoes. It reflects Peru’s multicultural culinary heritage and is widely enjoyed across the country.
healthy_modifications: use lean beef or substitute with chicken or tofu
serve with quinoa instead of white rice

meals.name: Aji de Gallina
meals.description: A creamy chicken stew made with shredded chicken in a spicy, nutty aji amarillo (yellow chili) sauce, traditionally served with potatoes and rice. It is a comforting home-style dish with deep cultural roots.
healthy_modifications: use low-fat milk or vegetable broth instead of cream

meals.name: Anticuchos
meals.description: Grilled skewers of marinated meat, traditionally beef heart, served with spicy sauces. A popular street food with roots in indigenous and Afro-Peruvian cultures, symbolizing communal eating and celebration.
healthy_modifications: use leaner cuts or chicken breast
serve with fresh salad or corn

meals.name: Papa a la Huancaína
meals.description: Boiled potatoes topped with a spicy, creamy sauce made from aji amarillo, cheese, and milk. It is a classic appetizer from the highlands, showcasing native potatoes and local peppers.
healthy_modifications: serve with fresh lettuce or vegetables

meals.name: Tacu Tacu
meals.description: A traditional Afro-Peruvian dish of fried rice and beans mixed and pan-fried into a crispy cake, often served with a protein like steak or seafood. It reflects the fusion of African and Peruvian culinary traditions.
healthy_modifications: add more vegetables to the mix

meals.name: Cau Cau
meals.description: A tripe stew cooked with potatoes, yellow chili, and herbs, reflecting Lima’s Creole culinary tradition. It is a hearty dish often served with rice.
healthy_modifications: use lean cuts or substitute with chicken

meals.name: Arroz con Mariscos
meals.description: Peruvian-style seafood rice, similar to paella, combining a variety of fresh seafood with rice, peppers, and herbs. It is a coastal favorite highlighting Peru’s rich marine resources.

meals.name: Ocopa
meals.description: Boiled potatoes served with a spicy, creamy sauce made from aji amarillo, peanuts, and herbs. It is a traditional dish from Arequipa, often served as an appetizer or side.
healthy_modifications: use native potatoes for more nutrients

responsePreview: Found 10 dishes: Ceviche, Pachamanca, Lomo Saltado...

meals.name: Ceviche
meals.description: A traditional Peruvian dish of raw fish marinated in lime juice, mixed with ají chili, onion, and coriander. It is culturally significant as a national symbol and part of daily and festive meals, recognized by UNESCO as Intangible Cultural Heritage.
healthy_modifications: serve with boiled sweet potatoes instead of fried sides

meals.name: Pachamanca
meals.description: An ancient Andean ritual dish cooked underground with volcanic stones, combining meats (lamb, pork, chicken), native potatoes, corn, fava beans, and Andean herbs. It honors Pachamama (Mother Earth) and is a communal feast.
healthy_modifications: increase proportion of native tubers and legumes

meals.name: Lomo Saltado
meals.description: A popular stir-fry dish combining beef strips with tomatoes, onions, and ají amarillo, reflecting Chinese influence in Peruvian cuisine. It is widely eaten across Peru as a hearty meal.
healthy_modifications: use lean beef or substitute with chicken breast
serve with quinoa or brown rice instead of white rice

meals.name: Aji de Gallina
meals.description: A creamy chicken stew made with shredded chicken in a spicy, nutty ají amarillo sauce with cheese and bread. It is a comfort food staple in Peruvian households.
healthy_modifications: use low-fat milk or plant-based milk
replace white bread with whole grain bread

meals.name: Anticuchos
meals.description: Skewered and grilled meat, traditionally beef heart, marinated in vinegar and ají panca. It is a popular street food with deep roots in Andean culture.
healthy_modifications: serve with fresh salad or corn instead of fried potatoes

meals.name: Causa Limeña
meals.description: A layered cold dish made with mashed yellow potatoes seasoned with lime and ají amarillo, filled with tuna, chicken, or avocado. It is a refreshing appetizer or light meal.
healthy_modifications: use olive oil instead of mayonnaise
use fresh tuna or chicken breast

meals.name: Tacu Tacu
meals.description: A traditional dish of rice and beans fried together, often served with a protein like steak or fried egg. It originated as a way to use leftovers and is a staple comfort food.
healthy_modifications: serve with grilled lean protein and vegetables

meals.name: Papa a la Huancaína
meals.description: Boiled yellow potatoes served with a spicy, creamy sauce made from ají amarillo, cheese, and milk. It is a classic appetizer from the Huancayo region.
healthy_modifications: serve with fresh lettuce and tomato

meals.name: Pollo a la Brasa
meals.description: Peruvian rotisserie chicken marinated with spices and cooked over charcoal or wood fire. It is one of the most popular dishes nationwide.
healthy_modifications: serve with salad and baked potatoes instead of fries

meals.name: Ocopa Arequipeña
meals.description: Boiled potatoes topped with a spicy sauce made from ají amarillo, peanuts, cheese, and huacatay herb. It is a traditional dish from Arequipa.
